column1: Zwijndrecht (Dutch pronunciation: [ˈzʋɛi̯ndrɛxt] (listen)) is a town and municipality in the western Netherlands. It is located in the province of South Holland
column2: at the southern tip of the island of IJsselmonde
column3: and at the confluence of the rivers Oude Maas

column1: The town of Zwijndrecht is one of the "Drecht" cities. Part of the suburban zone south of Rotterdam

column2: the municipality of Zwijndrecht also includes the villages of Heerjansdam and Kleine-Lindt. It had a population of 44

column1: Zwijndrecht has the highest concentration of Estonians in the Netherlands.The Evangelical Theological Academy is located here.
The town is served by a railway station of the same name (Station Zwijndrecht).
By train you go north to Rotterdam and The Hague
column2: and south it takes you to either Breda or Roosendaal.

column1: Water bus routes 21 and 24 both stop at (Zwijndrecht Veerplein)
Dordrecht HooikadeThe road buses are operated by Qbuzz. Routes connect to Dordrecht
column2: Rotterdam and other places in the Drechtsteden.

column1: Also Zwijndrecht is an important town for cargo transportation. It connects highways together with highway A16 and it connects rivers together with river De Oude Maas. Even for train cargo they have an important connection. For train cargo there is a classification yard that's called Kijfhoek
column2: It's one of the most important and biggest classification yards in Europe.

column1: Peter van Dalen (born 1958) politician and Member of the European Parliament

column2: R&B and hip hop record producer

column1: Ralph Barendse (born 1977) a DJ and producer of electronic dance music
Nikki de Roest (born 1993) educator and formerly a female association football player
